summary: Oropharyngeal cancer is a type of head and neck cancer that affects the oropharynx, including the base of the tongue, tonsils, soft palate, and pharyngeal walls. It is characterized by the abnormal growth of cells that can spread locally and to other parts of the body. The disease is classified into HPV-positive and HPV-negative subtypes, with different risk factors and prognoses.
risk_factors: Performing open-mouthed kissing or oral/mouth-genital sex on a person with HPV
Diet low in fruit and vegetables
symptoms: Sore throat that does not go away
Pain or ringing in the ears
Lump in the back of the throat or mouth
diagnosis: Staging according to cell appearance, dimensions, and extent
